dict.string: Bluetooth Peripheral services are used to communicate with Bluetooth readers to open doors or login to services when you present your device.

Location services are used to find and sense the distance from door readers and computers as you approach them. If you enable the leashing option then background services are not required. Location service are also used to enforce geographic fencing rules. If you do not allow location services then some organization resources may not be available to you. Refer to the privacy menu for the location events requested by your organization

Location services are used to find and sense the distance from door readers and computers as you approach them. If you enable the leashing option then background services are not required. Location service are also used to enforce geographic fencing rules. If you do not allow location services then some organization resources may not be available to you. Refer to the privacy menu for the location events requested by your organization

Location services are used to find and sense the distance from door readers and computers as you approach them. If you enable the leashing option then background services are not required. Location service are also used to enforce geographic fencing rules. If you do not allow location services then some organization resources may not be available to you. Bluetooth services are used to communicate with Bluetooth sensors to open doors or login to services when you present your device.
